name: Douglas VANN, Appellant, v. SCHOOL DISTRICT OF PHILADELPHIA, Appellee

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS, JJ.
LARSEN, J., files a dissenting opinion.
parties: Douglas VANN, Appellant, v. SCHOOL DISTRICT OF PHILADELPHIA, Appellee.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Filed: May 27, 1988
The judgment of the Superior Court, 348 Pa.Super. 383, 502 A.2d 260, in the above-captioned matter is hereby affirmed, based on our decision in Jerry Lewis v. School District of Philadelphia, 517 Pa. 461, 538 A.2d 862 (1988).
LARSEN, J., files a dissenting opinion.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

opinions.text:
LARSEN, Justice,
dissenting.
I dissent and would reverse the Superior Court’s decisions in this matter based upon my dissenting opinion in Jerry Lewis v. School District of Philadelphia, 517 Pa. 461, 538 A.2d 862 (1988).
opinions.author: LARSEN, Justice,

attorneys: Bruce Martin Ginsburg, Philadelphia, for appellant.
Martin Horowitz, Andrew M. Rosen, Philadelphia, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
541 A.2d 1134
Douglas VANN, Appellant, v. SCHOOL DISTRICT OF PHILADELPHIA, Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Dec. 11, 1987.
Decided May 27, 1988.
Bruce Martin Ginsburg, Philadelphia, for appellant.
Martin Horowitz, Andrew M. Rosen, Philadelphia, for appellee.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS, JJ.
